abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Greater Aden Second Water Supply
            Project in Yemen. The Project objectives were: (i) to
            increase the water production to meet the peak demand for
            the year 2000; and (ii) to carry out a program to improve
            the operations of the former Public Water Corporation (PWC).
            Bank's performance was not satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was not satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (i)co-financing and
            parallel financing is not always suitable, and participate
            in causing delay in implementation; (ii) project
            Implementation Unit has to be provided with necessary
            possibilities, support, and enough space of authority to be
            effective, and can improve its performance to meet the
            requirements of financiers; (iii) further training in water
            sector management is needed for field technical employees,
            rather than the office management who considers the training
            as touring visit; and, (iv) further improving operational
            and administrative efficiency is required for the Branch
            particularly in the following aspects:(a) the reduction of
            unaccounted-for water;(b) introducing computerization system
            for the main departments;(c) restructuring of the Branch;
            and,(d) reconsidering of water tariffs.
